[blockly](./blockly.md) &gt; [Events](./blockly.events_namespace.md) &gt; [BlockMove](./blockly.events_namespace.blockmove_class.md)

## Events.BlockMove class

Notifies listeners when a block is moved. This could be from one connection to another, or from one location on the workspace to another.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare class BlockMove extends BlockBase 
```
**Extends:** [BlockBase](./blockly.events_namespace.blockbase_class.md)

</td><td>


</td><td>

[Coordinate](./blockly.utils_namespace.coordinate_class.md)


</td><td>

</td></tr>

[oldInputName?](./blockly.events_namespace.blockmove_class.oldinputname_property.md)

</td><td>

_(Optional)_ The name of the old input. Undefined if it was a top-level block or the parent's next block.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[oldParentId?](./blockly.events_namespace.blockmove_class.oldparentid_property.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ The ID of the old parent block. Undefined if it was a top-level block.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[reason?](./blockly.events_namespace.blockmove_class.reason_property.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

string\[\]


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ An explanation of what this move is for. Known values include: 'drag' -- A drag operation completed. 'bump' -- Block got bumped away from an invalid connection. 'snap' -- Block got shifted to line up with the grid. 'inbounds' -- Block got pushed back into a non-scrolling workspace. 'connect' -- Block got connected to another block. 'disconnect' -- Block got disconnected from another block. 'create' -- Block created via XML. 'cleanup' -- Workspace aligned top-level blocks. Event merging may create multiple reasons: \['drag', 'bump', 'snap'\].


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[type](./blockly.events_namespace.blockmove_class.type_property.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

EventType


</td><td>


</td></tr>
